params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the active plan to archive.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The archived plan.

Rejected - Error message.

description:
The `archivePlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly-archived plan.

When a plan is archived, the plan
- Is no longer available for display or selection by visitors. This is because the plan's `public` property is automatically set to `false`.
- Cannot be purchased.
- Cannot be "un-archived", meaning the plan cannot be made active again.

Plan archiving does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases for the plan are still active and keep their payment options and terms.

Site owners can see archived plans in the Dashboard under **Pricing Plans -> Archived Plans**.

>**Note:** An attempt to archive an already-archived plan throws an error.

examples.title: Archive a plan
body: /* Returns a promise that resolves to a plan object for the archived plan:
*     "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",

params.name: ids
params.doc: IDs of all non-archived plans in the order you want them arranged.

docs.summary: Changes the display order of the pricing plans on the site page and in the Dashboard.
description:
The `arrangePlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the plans are rearranged on the site page and in the Dashboard.

To rearrange the order of the plans, provide a list of the IDs for all non-archived plans in the desired order, including hidden plans.

>**Note:** Make sure to provide *all* non-archived plan IDs to avoid unpredictable results.

examples.title: Arrange plans in a specific order
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void

docs.summary: Sets all pricing plans to no longer be primary.
description:
The `clearPrimary()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when there are no pricing plans marked as `primary`.

After clearing the primary plan, when viewing pricing plans on the site, no plan is highlighted with a customizable ribbon.

examples.title: Make no plans primary, clearing the highlight and the ribbon on the site
body: // No pricing plans are set as primary. This means
// no plans are highlighted with a custom ribbon
console.log("No plans are highlighted on the site");
// Returns a promise that resolves to void

params.name: plan
params.doc: Information for the plan being created.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The created plan.

Rejected - Error message.

description:
The `createPlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a newly-created pricing plan after is has successfully been created.

The passed `plan` object must contain a [pricing model](#introduction). A pricing model can be one of the following:
- **A subscription**: A subscription with recurring payment and how often the plan occurs. Subscriptions can have free trial days.
- **A plan that does not renew**: A single payment for a specific duration that doesn't renew.
- **An unlimited plan**: A single payment for an unlimited amount of time (until canceled).

Pricing plans created by this function are available to the site owner in the Pricing Plans section in the Dashboard.

examples.title: Create a plan
body: "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",
*     "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",

description: The `getPlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a plan whose ID matched the specified ID.

The `getPlanStats()` function returns a Promise that resolves to statistics about the plan on the site.

Currently this function provides only the total number of pricing plans, including archived plans.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the pricing plan to set as the primary plan.

docs.summary: Marks a pricing plan as the primary pricing plan.
description:
The `makePlanPrimary()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the now primary pricing plan.

Only a single plan can be marked as a primary plan at any given time. If there is an existing plan marked as primary, calling `makePlanPrimary()` causes the existing primary plan to lose its primary status.

When viewing pricing plans on the site, the primary plan is highlighted with a customizable ribbon.

examples.title: Make a plan a primary plan
body: /* Full plan object - primary is true:
*         "There are no words to describe this extreme game",

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of public pricing plans.
description: The `queryPublicPlans()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of up to 1,000 public plans and returns a [`PublicPlansQueryBuilder`](#plansquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](#plansquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `PublicPlansQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `PublicPlansQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryPublicPlans()` returns.
`queryPublicPlans()` runs with the following `PublicPlansQueryBuilder` defaults that you can override:
- [`skip`](#plansquerybuilder/skip): `0`
- [`limit`](#plansquerybuilder/limit): `50`

The functions that are chained to `queryPublicPlans()` are applied in the order they are called. For example, if you sort on the `_createdDate` property in ascending order and then on the `_id` property in ascending order, the results are sorted first by the created date of the items and then, if there are multiple results with the same date, the items are sorted by `_id` in ascending order, per created date value.

The following `PublicPlansQueryBuilder` functions are supported for the `queryPublicPlans()` function. For a full description of the Plans object, see the object returned for the [`items`](#plansqueryresult/items) property in [`PublicPlansQueryResult`](#plansqueryresult).
|PROPERTY	|SUPPORTED FILTERS & SORTING

|`id`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ne),[`exists()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#exists),[`in()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#in),[`hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#hasSome),[`startsWith()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#startsWith),[`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`primary`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ne),[`exists()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#exists),[`in()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#in),[`hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#hasSome),[`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`createdDate`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ne),[`exists()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#exists),[`in()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#in),[`hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#hasSome),[`gt()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#gt),[`lt()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#lt),[`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`updatedDate`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ne),[`exists()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#exists),[`in()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#in),[`hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#hasSome),[`gt()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#gt),[`lt()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#lt),[`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`slug`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ne),[`exists()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#exists),[`in()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#in),[`hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#hasSome),[`startsWith()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#startsWith),[`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-v2.Plans.PlansQueryBuilder#descending)|

body: *       "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",

params.name: _id
params.doc: The ID of the plan to either display or hide on the site page.

params.name: visible
params.doc: Whether to set the plan as visible.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The plan's information.

Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Sets visibility for non-archived pricing plans.
description:
The `setPlanVisibility()` functions returns a Promise that resolves to a pricing plan when its visibility has successfully been set.

By default, pricing plans are public, meaning they are visible. [Plans can be hidden](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-removing-a-plan-from-your-site#hiding-plans) so that site members and visitors cannot see or choose them.

As opposed to archiving, setting visibility can be reversed. This means that a public plan can be hidden, and a hidden plan can be made public (visible).

>**Note:** An archived plan always remains archived and cannot be made active again. When archiving a plan, its `public` property is automatically set to `false` so that it is hidden.

Changing a plan's visibility does not impact existing orders for the plan. All orders for hidden plans are still active and keep their terms and payment options.

examples.title: Hide a plan
body: console.log("Plan hidden");  // Plan is visible in the Dashboard

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the plan to update.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The updated plan.

Rejected - Error message.

description:
The `updatePlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an updated plan.

Updating a plan does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases keep the details of the original plan that was active at the time of the purchase.

examples.title: Update a plan
body: "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",
*     "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",

Unit of time for the cycle duration.

members.doc: Total number of plans created, including active plans (both public and hidden) and archived plans.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Archived filter.

Supported values: `"ACTIVE"`, `"ARCHIVED"`, `"ARCHIVED_AND_ACTIVE"`.

Default: `"ACTIVE"` (not archived).

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of pricing plans to list.

Default: `75`.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of pricing plans to skip.

Default: `0`.

members.name: planIds
members.doc: IDs of plans to list. If non-existent IDs are specified, they are ignored and don't cause errors. If no IDs are specified, all public and hidden plans (based on `options`) are listed according to the [order](#arrangeplans) displayed in the Dashboard. You can pass a maximum of 100 IDs.

members.name: public
members.doc:
Visibility filter.

Supported values: `"PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN"`, `"PUBLIC"`, `"HIDDEN"`.

Default: `"PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN"` (meaning, both public and hidden plans are listed).

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Archived filter.

Supported values: `"ACTIVE"`, `"ARCHIVED"`, `"ARCHIVED_AND_ACTIVE"`.

Default: `"ACTIVE"` (not archived).

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of pricing plans to list.

Default: `75`.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of pricing plans to skip.

Default: `0`.

members.name: planIds
members.doc: IDs of plans to list. If non-existent IDs are specified, they are ignored and don't cause errors. If no IDs are specified, all public and hidden plans (based on `options`) are listed according to the [order](#arrangeplans) displayed in the Dashboard. You can pass a maximum of 100 IDs.

members.name: public
members.doc:
Visibility filter.

Supported values: `"PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN"`, `"PUBLIC"`, `"HIDDEN"`.

Default: `"PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN"` (meaning, both public and hidden plans are listed).

members.doc: Primary plan info.

members.name: currency
members.doc:
Currency code. Three-letter currency code in
[ISO-4217 alphabetic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) format. For example, `'USD'`.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator. For example, `'3.99'`. Cannot be a negative value.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date plan was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Plan ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date plan was last updated.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc:
Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date.

Default: `false`.

members.name: archived
members.doc: Whether the plan is archived. Archived plans are not visible and can't be purchased anymore, but existing purchases remain in effect.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc:
Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. If `false`, calling the [`cancelOrder()`](../cancelorder) function returns an error.

Default: `false`.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: hasOrders
members.doc: Whether the plan has any orders (including pending and unpaid orders).

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc:
Number of times the same buyer can purchase the plan. Currently limited to support:
- Empty value or a value of `0`, meaning no limitation.
- Value of `1`, meaning limited to one purchase per buyer.

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: perks
members.doc:
List of text strings that promote what is included with this plan.

For example, "Plenty of parking" or "Free gift on your birthday".

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: primary
members.doc:
Whether the plan is marked as primary. If `true`, the plan is highlighted on the site with a custom ribbon.

Default: `false`.

members.name: public
members.doc: Whether the plan is public (visible to site visitors and members).

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly version of plan name. Unique across all plans in the same site.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information will be displayed during checkout.

description: Information about the pricing plan.

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: Free trial period for the plan in days. Available only for recurring plans, meaning plans whose pricing model is `subscription`. Set to `0` to remove the free trial.

members.name: price
members.doc: Amount for a single payment. For subscriptions, this is the amount to pay each payment cycle and it is required. For plans that are not recurring plans, it is the single payment amount for the whole subscription.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model indicating a single payment per cycle and the length of the cycle. The cycle is the duration of the plan, not a payment cycle.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model indicating the plan is paid in one single payment. The plan is valid until canceled.

members.name: subscription
members.doc:
Pricing model indicating that the plan has recurring payments.

Note: This type of subscription is not a "Wix subscription," which encompasses various types of subscriptions, such as Wix Stores subscriptions, Wix invoice subscriptions, and *all* pricing plan models.

description: Plan pricing information. Includes the price of the plan and payment details.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: One time payment, plan is valid for the specified duration.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: One time payment, plan is valid until it is canceled.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Plan has recurring payments.
